meanings: be pulled down by one´s illness
look emaciated, (be) haggard, look worn-out, (be) thin, skinny, tired

vlive.korean: 약간 거칠 것 같은 - 맞아요 - 거칠 것 같은?

vlive.english: It might sound a bit rough.
I didn't know he was going to play that.

vlive.korean: 형이 형이 있잖아요. 형이 거칠 때는 어때요?
vlive.english: You have an older brother. What do you do when he's being rough?

vlive.korean: 퇴근하는 길에 사옥에서든 어디서든 숙소로 가는 길에 홍대를 거칠 때가 많아요.
vlive.english: I often go through Hongdae on my way home or to the company.

examples.korean: 모든 일이 거칠 것 없이 진행됐다
나는 누구를 만나더라도 거칠 것이 없다
examples.english: Whoever I meet, I have nothing to fear.

examples.korean: 한국어의 사용으로 한국인은 지루한 번역 과정을 거칠 필요가 없게 되었다.
examples.english: The use of Korean will make it unnecessary for Koreans to undergo the tedious process of translating.

examples.korean: 지난 달 일본은 외국인들이 일본에 도착할 때 모든 외국인들에게 이 과정을 거칠 것을 요구하였다.
examples.english: Last month, Japan began requiring all foreigners to go through this process when they arrive in the country.

examples.korean: 그런 극도로 복잡한 의식을 거칠 필요가 뭐냐?
examples.english: What's the point of going through the bell, book, and candle?
